intro: Campyloneurum tucumanense, commonly known as the Tucumán fern, is a species of polypodioid fern native to South America. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced in small, clustered sori on the underside of its fertile fronds. The botanical features of Campyloneurum tucumanense make it a distinctive member of the Polypodiaceae family.
